status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqscp","text":"Inoculate about 1 g of sample into two tubes with preregenerated (by thermal deoxygenation or conditioning in anaerobic conditions) TPGY broth. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fos0m","text":"Submit half of inoculated tubes to pasteurisation process at 70°C for 15 min and then incubate all of them in an anaerobic jar/chamber  at 30°C or 37°C (optionally) for 48h, under anaerobic conditions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cdh4r","text":"After incubation, check turbidity of broth and gas production abilities of each culture. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8d997","text":"Subsequently, strike about 10µl liquid culture (collected from the bottom of each tube) onto surface of Willis – Hobbs or FAA agar. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b6rrn","text":"Subject stroked agar plates into incubation process at 30°C or 37°C (optionally) for 48h, under anaerobic conditions. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2hrtl","text":"After incubation evaluate change of agar colour, proteolytic properties (uncoloured zones surrounding colonies), lecythynolytic abilities (precipitation zones around colonies), lipolytic properties (characteristic pearl, shining layer of colonies surface). {"blocks":[{"key":"6q8d5","text":"Make a thin film of the material on a clean glass slide, using a sterile loop. Air dry, then heat fix the slide by passing it several times through a flame (the slide should not become too hot to touch). Failure to follow these directions may cause staining artifacts and disrupt the normal morphology of bacteria and cells.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6hk9m","text":" ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9e1pd","text":"1. Flood slide with crystal (or gentian) violet- 60 seconds.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10vjn","text":" ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bc9l","text":"2. Flood with Gram's iodine - 180 seconds.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61c4u","text":" ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9btd","text":"3. Carefully decolorize with 95% ethanol until thinnest parts of the smear are colourless. (Wash with water).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dseek","text":" ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"epvpt","text":"This third step is the most critical and also the one most affected by technical variations in timing and","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ap1r","text":"reagents.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cm3c","text":" ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"q2c5","text":"4. steps.section: Amplification and Sequencing of Clostridia 16S rDNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"18lfr","text":"For identification of 16S rDNA from unidentified anaerobic strains suspected of being Clostridium sp., primers previously described by Vaneechoutte et al.1996 could be used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ulmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bkee3","text":"Reactions should be performed in the volume of 25 µL with the following reagent constituents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm0vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"erpa9","text":" 3 µL of DNA matrix, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8gkah","text":"2.5 µL 10× Taq buffer with KCl, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4qoku","text":"4 mM MgCl2, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8cms","text":"200 µM dNTP, and ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cvcpc","text":"1.25 U per 25 µL Taq polymerase. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7bt4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b5bf","text":"The reaction was staged as follows: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ft1pb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1976b","text":"initial denaturation at 95°C for 5 min,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eebt4","text":" 35 cycles of denaturation at 95°C for 45 sec, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"enqj8","text":"annealing at 55°C for 45 sec,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2pomk","text":" extension at 72° for 1 min,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bkbmq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"tp3p","text":" and a final extension at 72°C for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
